Class SparkJobConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • distributed.core.DistributedJobConfig
      • distributed.spark.BaseSparkJobConfig
        • distributed.spark.SparkJobConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, OptionHandler

    public class SparkJobConfig
extends BaseSparkJobConfig
    Basic connection options and settings for a batch Spark job.

    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)

      • minInputSlicesTipText

        public java.lang.String minInputSlicesTipText()
        Tip text for this property

        the tip text for this property

      • getMinInputSlices

        public java.lang.String getMinInputSlices()
        Get the minimum number of input splits to create from the input file. By default there is 1 split per 64Mb block (HDFS block size), so there can't be fewer splits than there are blocks in the file. However, there can be more splits.
        Returns:
        the number of splits to create

      • setMinInputSlices

        public void setMinInputSlices(java.lang.String slices)
        Set the minimum number of input splits (partitions) to create from the input file. By default there is 1 split per 64Mb block (HDFS block size), so there can't be fewer splits than there are blocks in the file. However, there can be more splits.
        Parameters:
        slices - the number of splits to create

      • maxInputSlicesTipText

        public java.lang.String maxInputSlicesTipText()
        Returns:
        the tip text for this property

      • getMaxInputSlices

        public java.lang.String getMaxInputSlices()
        Get the maximum number of input splits (partitions) to create from the input file. If this is fewer than the natural number of partitions (i.e. as determined by the HDFS block size) then this will trigger a coalesce.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of splits/partitions to create from an input file.

      • setMaxInputSlices

        public void setMaxInputSlices(java.lang.String max)
        Set the maximum number of input splits (partitions) to create from the input file. If this is fewer than the natural number of partitions (i.e. as determined by the HDFS block size) then this will trigger a coalesce.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum number of splits/partitions to create from an input file.
